intro: Cheilanthes velutina, commonly known as the velvet fern, is a species of fern that belongs to the family Polypodiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. This plant is characterized by its dense, velvety fronds that give it its common name. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in crevices or on cliff faces. Cheilanthes velutina is a perennial plant that is well adapted to drought conditions.
